referable-content.title: Conref steps: assigning a new host node
referable-content.shortdesc: You can use controller-0 to assign a configuration or personality (controller, compute, or storage, for example) to a new node.

context.p: You can assign one of the following personalities.

prereq.p: Before initializing a node, ensure that the following conditions are satisfied:

li.p: The node must meet the hardware requirements for the personality to be assigned. For more information, see the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Software Installation Guide: Hardware Requirements.
Controller-0 must be installed and configured.
The node must be connected to the internal management network or PXE boot network using an Ethernet interface configured for PXE boot.
The node must be connected to the internal management network using the PXE boot network.
The node must be configured in the BIOS to boot from the internal management network or PXE boot network.
The node must be configured in the BIOS to boot from the PXE boot network.

step.cmd: Add the host to the system inventory.

note.p: The host must be added to the system inventory before it is powered on.

info.p: On controller-0, acquire Keystone administrative privileges:

US62814, US62816 update host-add parametersUS63466 adds -DUse the system host-add command to add a host and specify its personality. You can also specify the device used to display messages during boot.

codeblock.userinput: system host-add -n hostname -p personality \ [-l location] [-o install_output[-c console]] [-b boot_device] \ [-r rootfs_device] [-m mgmt_mac] [-i mgmt_ip] [-D ttys_dcd] \ [-T bm_type -M bm_mac -I bm_ip -U bm_username -P bm_password]

info.p: where

pd.p: is a name to assign to the host
is the host type (controller or compute)
is the host type (controller, storage, or compute)
is a string describing the location of the host
is the output device to use for message display on the host (for example, tty0). The default is ttys0, 115200)
is the format for console output on the host (text or graphical). The default is text.
is the host device for boot partition, relative to /dev. The default is sda.
is the host device for rootfs partition, relative to /dev. The default is sda.
is the MAC address of the port connected to the management or PXE boot network.

is the IP address of the port connected to the management or PXE boot network, if static IP address allocation is used.
The mgmt_ip option is not used for a controller node.

is set to True to have any active console session automatically logged out when the Serial Console cable is removed, or False to disable this behavior. The server must support data carrier detect on the serial console port.
is the board management controller type (iLO3, iOL4 or Quanta)
is the board management controller MAC address
is the board management controller IP address
is the username for board management controller access
is the password for board management controller access

info.p: With controller-0 running, start the host.
The host boots from the network.
It is assigned the personality specified in the system host-add parameters, and restarted automatically.
A display-device menu appears on the console, with text customized for the personality (Controller, Storage, or Compute Node).

image.alt: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Controller Node Install

info.p: With controller-0 running, start the host.
The host boots from the network.

image.alt: Waiting for this node to be configured.

info.p: The active controller assigns an id when the host is detected. To update the host with a personality from the command line, the id is required.
You can obtain the id using the system host-list command , as follows:
This example shows the output when the first host is powered on after controller-0 has been configured.

step.cmd: On the controller-0 console, set the attributes of the host.

info.p: US62814, US62816 update host-update parametersUS63466 adds ttys_dcdUse a command of the following form to specify the name and personality of the host, as well as the settings for displaying messages during boot:

codeblock.userinput: system host-update hostid personality=personality location=location \ console=console install_output=install_output ttys_dcd=serial \ boot_device=boot_device rootfs_device=rootfs_device

info.p: where

pd.p: is the numeric id of the host obtained using the system host-list command
is a name to assign to the host
is the host type (controller or compute)
is the host type (controller, storage, or compute)
is a string describing the location of the host
is the output device to use for message display on the host (for example, tty0). The default is ttys0, 115200)
is the format for console output on the host (text or graphical). The default is text.

is set to true to True to have any active console session automatically logged out when the Serial Console cable is removed, or False to disable this behavior. The server must support data carrier detect on the serial console port.
is the host device for boot partition, relative to /dev. The default is sda.
is the host device for rootfs partition, relative to /dev. The default is sda.

stepresult.p: Controller-0 configures the required parameters and displays them as illustrated above. The host is still reported as offline, since the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade software has yet to be installed in its hard drive.

Controller-0 automatically pushes the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installer image over the network for the host to boot. The console of the host displays the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade welcome screen.

image.alt: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Controller Node Install

step.cmd: Assign the required personality to the node.

info.p: On the Admin tab, in the System Panel section, click Inventory, and then select the Hosts tab.

stepresult.p: The new node is listed with an empty Host Name and Personality.

info.p: Click Edit Host for the new host.

substep.cmd: Select the Personality for the new node.
Type a physical Location for the node to help identify it.
US63466 adds Enable Serial Console Data Carrier Detect.

info.p: Set this option to have any active console session automatically logged out when the Serial Console cable is removed, or False to disable this behavior. The server must support data carrier detect on the serial console port.

substep.cmd: US62816 addedSet the installation parameters for the node.

info.p: You can optionally set the boot device, rootfs device, and display mode for installation on the Installation Parameters tab.

dd.p: is the host device for boot partition, relative to /dev. The default is sda.
is the host device for rootfs partition, relative to /dev. The default is sda.
is the format for console output on the host (text or graphical). The default is text.

note.p: If using graphical, update the Console field to use a console that supports graphical output.

dd.p: is the output device to use for message display on the host (for example, tty0). The default is ttys0, 115200. Note that this is not updated to reflect changes to the Installation Output setting.

substep.cmd: Click Save to initialize and configure the new node.

stepresult.p: The node is restarted automatically, and a display-device menu appears on the node console.

image.alt: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Controller Node Install

substep.cmd: AS OF 15.09 THIS SUBSTEP IS NO LONGER APPLICABLE Select the display device to use during initialization.

info.p: The personality (Controller, Compute, or Storage) is confirmed in the menu.

dd.p: Use the serial port to display messages. You can monitor the port using the terminal server.
Use the graphics port in graphics mode to display messages. This selection works with most console displays.
Use the graphics port in text mode to display messages. This is a safe option for nodes that do not support graphics mode.

info.p: If you do not change the selection, the default is applied automatically after a few seconds.

substep.cmd: Wait while the node is configured and rebooted.

info.p: After a few minutes, the node is reported as Locked, Disabled, and Online in the Hosts list.

note.p: To ensure a successful installation, wait for the node to be reported as Locked, Disabled, and Online, and ensure that the login prompt appears on the host console. If the process is interrupted prematurely, the host installation can fail.

stepresult.p: The host is now configured with a personality.

result.p: The new host is initialized with an operating system, rebooted, and configured with the assigned personality.
